author: blockkshane
content:
the way I implemented, per my understanding of the spec:
ptc selection for a slot is derived from balance weighted selection of a subset of validators from the attestation committees for that slot

a slot has multiple attestation committees, and I'm pretty sure validators can only be in one attestation committee per epoch. therefore, a validator can only be in a single ptc committee per epoch

but they can be in that same ptc commitee multiple times, due to the balance weighting selection

lmk if any incorrect assumptions

author: stefanbratanov
content: I remember I saw that from the spec tests, if there are fewer validators, the PTC can contain a single validator multiple times, so I guess it's still one vote per epoch but it can have a bigger weight

author: blockkshane
content:
yah, so for scenario with very few validators in the slot's attestation committees, the validator with significantly higher weight will likely appear the most in that ptc committee. since ptc committee will always have 512 validators no matter what, gotta fill them up

> it's still one vote per epoch but it can have a bigger weight
more technically, they're only gonna actually submit one vote per epoch at most. but their vote can be counted multiple times if they appear at multiple positions within the ptc commitee
